001 package de.general.json;

003 
004 import java.io.*;
005 import java.util.HashMap;
006 import java.util.Iterator;
007 
008 
009 /**
010  *
011  * @author knauth
012  */
013 public class JObject extends JContainer
014 {
015 
016     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
017     // Properties
018     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
019 
020     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
021     // Variables
022     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
023 
024     HashMap<String, JProperty> properties;
025 
026     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
027     // Constructors
028     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
029 
030     /**
031      * Constructor.
032      */
033     public JObject()
034     {
035         this.properties = new HashMap<String, JProperty>();
036     }
037 
038     /**
039      * Constructor.
040      */
041     public JObject(JProperty property)
042     {
043         this.properties = new HashMap<String, JProperty>();
044         this.properties.put(property.getName(), property);
045     }
046 
047     /**
048      * Constructor.
049      */
050     public JObject(JProperty p1, JProperty p2)
051     {
052         this.properties = new HashMap<String, JProperty>();
053         this.properties.put(p1.getName(), p1);
054         this.properties.put(p2.getName(), p2);
055     }
056 
057     /**
058      * Constructor.
059      */
060     public JObject(JProperty p1, JProperty p2, JProperty p3)
061     {
062         this.properties = new HashMap<String, JProperty>();
063         this.properties.put(p1.getName(), p1);
064         this.properties.put(p2.getName(), p2);
065         this.properties.put(p3.getName(), p3);
066     }
067 
068     /**
069      * Constructor.
070      */
071     public JObject(JProperty p1, JProperty p2, JProperty p3, JProperty p4)
072     {
073         this.properties = new HashMap<String, JProperty>();
074         this.properties.put(p1.getName(), p1);
075         this.properties.put(p2.getName(), p2);
076         this.properties.put(p3.getName(), p3);
077         this.properties.put(p4.getName(), p4);
078     }
079 
080     /**
081      * Constructor.
082      */
083     public JObject(JProperty[] properties)
084     {
085         for (JProperty property : properties) {
086             this.properties = new HashMap<String, JProperty>();
087             this.properties.put(property.getName(), property);
088         }
089     }
090 
091     JObject(JSONObject obj) throws Exception
092     {
093         this.properties = new HashMap<String, JProperty>();
094         Iterator iterator = obj.keys();
095         while (iterator.hasNext()) {
096             String key = (String)(iterator.next());
097             properties.put(key, new JProperty(key, obj.get(key)));
098         }
099     }
100 
101     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
102     // Methods
103     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
104 
105     public void add(String propertyName, JToken value)
106     {
107         if ((propertyName == null) || (propertyName.length() == 0)
108             || (propertyName.trim().length() != propertyName.length()))
109             throw new RuntimeException("Invalid property name specified: " + propertyName);
110 
111         JProperty p = properties.get(propertyName);
112         if (p == null) {
113             p = new JProperty(propertyName, value);
114             properties.put(propertyName, p);
115         } else {
116             p.setValue(value);
117         }
118     }
119 
120     /**
121      * Convenience method to retrieve data from a property referring to a string value.
122      * If the property does not refer to a string value <code>null</code> is returned.
123      */
124     public String getPropertyStringValueNormalized(String[] propertyNamePath)
125     {
126         JObject o = this;
127         for (int i = 0; i < propertyNamePath.length - 1; i++) {
128             JProperty p = o.getProperty(propertyNamePath[i]);
129             if (p == null) return null;
130             if (p.getValue() == null) return null;
131             if (p.getValue() instanceof JObject) {
132                 o = (JObject)(p.getValue());
133             } else {
134                 return null;
135             }
136         }
137         return o.getPropertyStringValueNormalized(propertyNamePath[propertyNamePath.length - 1]);
138     }
139 
140     /**
141      * Convenience method to retrieve data from a property referring to a string value.
142      * If the property does not refer to a string value <code>null</code> is returned.
143      */
144     public String[] getPropertyStringListValueNormalized(String[] propertyNamePath)
145     {
146         JObject o = this;
147         for (int i = 0; i < propertyNamePath.length - 1; i++) {
148             JProperty p = o.getProperty(propertyNamePath[i]);
149             if (p == null) return null;
150             if (p.getValue() == null) return null;
151             if (p.getValue() instanceof JObject) {
152                 o = (JObject)(p.getValue());
153             } else {
154                 return null;
155             }
156         }
157         return o.getPropertyStringListValueNormalized(propertyNamePath[propertyNamePath.length - 1]);
158     }

161      * Convenience method to retrieve data from a property referring to a string value.
162      * If the property does not refer to a string value <code>null</code> is returned.
163      */
164     public JObject[] getPropertyObjectList(String[] propertyNamePath)
165     {
166         JObject o = this;
167         for (int i = 0; i < propertyNamePath.length - 1; i++) {
168             JProperty p = o.getProperty(propertyNamePath[i]);
169             if (p == null) return null;
170             if (p.getValue() == null) return null;
171             if (p.getValue() instanceof JObject) {
172                 o = (JObject)(p.getValue());
173             } else {
174                 return null;
175             }
176         }
177         return o.getPropertyObjectList(propertyNamePath[propertyNamePath.length - 1]);
178     }

180     /**
181      * Convenience method to retrieve data from a property referring to a string value.
182      * If the property does not refer to a string value <code>null</code> is returned.
183      */
184     public Integer getPropertyIntValue(String[] propertyNamePath)
185     {
186         JObject o = this;
187         for (int i = 0; i < propertyNamePath.length - 1; i++) {
188             JProperty p = o.getProperty(propertyNamePath[i]);
189             if (p == null) return null;
190             if (p.getValue() == null) return null;
191             if (p.getValue() instanceof JObject) {
192                 o = (JObject)(p.getValue());
193             } else {
194                 return null;
195             }
196         }
197         return o.getPropertyIntValue(propertyNamePath[propertyNamePath.length - 1]);
198     }

200     /**
201      * Convenience method to retrieve data from a property referring to a string value.
202      * If the property does not refer to a string value <code>null</code> is returned.
203      */
204     public String getPropertyStringValueNormalized(String propertyName)
205     {
206         JProperty p = getProperty(propertyName);
207         if (p == null) return null;
208         if (p.getValue() == null) return null;
209         if (p.getValue() instanceof JValue) {
210             JValue v = (JValue)(p.getValue());
211             if (v.getValue() == null) return null;
212             if (v.getValue() instanceof String) {
213                 String s = (String)(v.getValue());
214                 s = s.trim();
215                 if (s.length() == 0) return null;
216                 return s;
217             } else {
218                 return null;
219             }
220         } else {
221             return null;
222         }
223     }
224 
225     /**
226      * Convenience method to retrieve data from a property referring to a string value.
227      * If the property does not refer to a string value <code>null</code> is returned.
228      */
229     public String[] getPropertyStringListValueNormalized(String propertyName)
230     {
231         JProperty p = getProperty(propertyName);
232         if (p == null) return null;
233         if (p.getValue() == null) return null;
234         if (p.getValue() instanceof JArray) {
235             JArray v = (JArray)(p.getValue());
236             if (v == null) return null;
237             String[] ret = new String[v.elements.size()];
238             for (int i = 0; i < ret.length; i++) {
239                 if (v.get(i) instanceof JValue) {
240                     JValue v2 = (JValue)(v.get(i));
241                     if (v2.getValue() == null) continue;
242                     if (v2.getValue() instanceof String) {
243                         String s = (String)(v2.getValue());
244                         s = s.trim();
245                         if (s.length() == 0) s = null;
246                         ret[i] = s;
247                     } else {
248                         // invalid type
249                     }
250                 } else {
251                     // invalid type
252                 }
253             }
254             return ret;
255         } else {
256             // invalid type
257             return null;
258         }
259     }
260 
261     /**
262      * Convenience method to retrieve data from a property referring to a string value.
263      * If the property does not refer to a string value <code>null</code> is returned.
264      */
265     public JObject[] getPropertyObjectList(String propertyName)
266     {
267         JProperty p = getProperty(propertyName);
268         if (p == null) return null;
269         if (p.getValue() == null) return null;
270         if (p.getValue() instanceof JArray) {
271             JArray v = (JArray)(p.getValue());
272             if (v == null) return null;
273             JObject[] ret = new JObject[v.elements.size()];
274             for (int i = 0; i < ret.length; i++) {
275                 if (v.get(i) instanceof JObject) {
276                     JObject v2 = (JObject)(v.get(i));
277                     ret[i] = v2;
278                 } else {
279                     // invalid type
280                 }
281             }
282             return ret;
283         } else {
284             // invalid type
285             return null;
286         }
287     }
288 
289     /**
290      * Convenience method to retrieve data from a property referring to an integer value.
291      * If the property does not refer to a string value <code>null</code> is returned.
292      */
293     public Integer getPropertyIntValue(String propertyName)
294     {
295         JProperty p = getProperty(propertyName);
296         if (p == null) return null;
297         if (p.getValue() == null) return null;
298         if (p.getValue() instanceof JValue) {
299             JValue v = (JValue)(p.getValue());
300             if (v.getValue() == null) return null;
301             if (v.getValue() instanceof Integer) {
302                 return (Integer)(v.getValue());
303             } else {
304                 return null;
305             }
306         } else {
307             return null;
308         }
309     }
310 
311     /**
312      * Convenience method to retrieve data from a property referring to a string value.
313      * If the property does not refer to a string value an exception is thrown.
314      */
315     public String getPropertyStringValueNormalizedE(String propertyName) throws Exception
316     {
317         JProperty p = getProperty(propertyName);
318         if (p == null) return null;
319         if (p.getValue() == null) return null;
320         if (p.getValue() instanceof JValue) {
321             JValue v = (JValue)(p.getValue());
322             if (v.getValue() == null) return null;
323             if (v.getValue() instanceof String) {
324                 String s = (String)(v.getValue());
325                 s = s.trim();
326                 if (s.length() == 0) return null;
327                 return s;
328             } else {
329                 throw new Exception("Value is not a String! (" + v.getValue().getClass().getCanonicalName() + ")");
330             }
331         } else {
332             throw new Exception("Member does not refer to a String! (" + p.getValue().getClass().getCanonicalName() + ")");
333         }
334     }
335 
336     /**
337      * Convenience method: Set the property named propertyName to refer to the specified value. If the
338      * specified value is <code>null</code> the property will be removed.
339      */
340     public void setStringValueTrim(String propertyName, String s)
341     {
342         remove(propertyName);
343         if (s != null) {
344             s = s.trim();
345             if (s.length() == 0) s = null;
346         }
347         if (s == null) return;
348         add(propertyName, new JValue(s));
349     }
350 
351     public JProperty[] getProperties()
352     {
353         return properties.values().toArray(new JProperty[properties.size()]);
354     }
355 
356     public JProperty getProperty(String propertyName)
357     {
358         if ((propertyName == null) || (propertyName.length() == 0)
359             || (propertyName.trim().length() != propertyName.length()))
360             throw new RuntimeException("Invalid property name specified: " + propertyName);
361 
362         JProperty p = properties.get(propertyName);
363         return p;
364     }
365 
366     public JToken getValue(String propertyName)
367     {
368         if ((propertyName == null) || (propertyName.length() == 0)
369             || (propertyName.trim().length() != propertyName.length()))
370             throw new RuntimeException("Invalid property name specified: " + propertyName);
371 
372         JProperty p = properties.get(propertyName);
373         if (p == null) return null;
374         return p.getValue();
375     }
376 
377     public boolean remove(String propertyName)
378     {
379         if ((propertyName == null) || (propertyName.length() == 0)
380             || (propertyName.trim().length() != propertyName.length()))
381             throw new RuntimeException("Invalid property name specified: " + propertyName);
382 
383         return properties.remove(propertyName) != null;
384     }
385 
386     @Override
387     public boolean hasValues()
388     {
389         return properties.size() > 0;
390     }
391 
392     @Override
393     public int getCount()
394     {
395         return properties.size();
396     }
397 
398     @Override
399     public String toString()
400     {
401         return "JObject[" + properties.size() + " members]";
402     }
403 
404     /**
405      * Perform a deep cloning.
406      */
407     @Override
408     public JToken cloneObject()
409     {
410         JObject ret = new JObject();
411         for (JProperty p : properties.values()) {
412             ret.add(p.getName(), p.getValue().cloneObject());
413         }
414         return ret;
415     }
416 
417     @Override
418     public boolean equals(Object obj)
419     {
420         if (obj instanceof JObject) {
421             JObject o = (JObject)obj;
422 
423             return (properties.equals(o.properties));
424         } else {
425             return false;
426         }
427     }
428 
429     @Override
430     public String toJSON()
431     {
432         StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
433         sb.append('{');
434         boolean bAddComma = false;
435         for (String key : properties.keySet()) {
436             JProperty p = properties.get(key);
437 
438             if (bAddComma) sb.append(',');
439             sb.append(p.toJSON());
440 
441             bAddComma = true;
442         }
443         sb.append('}');
444         return sb.toString();
445     }
